content.rendered:
What is an Accountant?

Accountants are professionals in charge of keeping tracks of a business’s financial transactions. While similar to Bookkeepers, Accountants differ in that they offer more of a consultation and analysis of your records.

Where does an Accountant work?

  • Organizations, agencies, and offices of all sizes
  • As contracted consultants

How much does an Accountant make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Accountant is $49,091.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Accountants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing accounting jobs.

  • Accounting majors
  • Math majors
  • Finance majors
Search Accountant job opportunities on Handshake.

Accountant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Accountants succeed in their work:

  • Strong critical thinking skills
  • Familiarity with data entry and spreadsheets
  • Interpersonal communication skills

What are some common questions about Accountants?

Q: What is the difference between bookkeeping and accounting?

A: Bookkeeping assumes a more administrative role that takes care of recording and organizing documents. Accountants are more concerned with providing insight and advising through their own analysis.
